definition: just a very few (idiom); tiny number/just a handful/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: By the end of his shows, only a few iron beasts still move.
sentences.chinese: 每次表演结束，还能自己动弹的铁武士就寥寥可数了。

sentences.english: Very few people were present at the meeting.
Few Chinese magazines can be found on the newsstands in Malaysia.
sentences.chinese: 马来西亚街头的书报摊，华文杂志寥寥可数。

sentences.english: Such refuges are few and far between.
sentences.chinese: 这样的避难所寥寥可数。

sentences.english: In the early 1900s , few women earned college degrees .
sentences.chinese: 二十世纪初，有大学学位的妇女寥寥可数。

definition: just a very few (idiom); tiny number/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
rare as morning stars (idiom)/few and far between/sparse
one can't tell how many/numerous similar cases
lit. their number cannot be counted (idiom); fig. countless/innumerable
as many as the hair of the ox (idiom)/great amount of/countless
only remaining of the great (idiom); one of the few greats extant
